intro: Rubus falcifer, commonly known as the sharp-leaved blackberry, is a species of brambles native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of deciduous forests. Due to its vigorous growth, it can form dense thickets that provide habitat for various wildlife species.
